overview: This measure, as finalized by the conference committee, appropriates funds for the Judiciary's operating and capital improvement costs for the 2025-2027 fiscal biennium. The final version sets the general fund operating budget at $201,725,676 for fiscal year 2025-2026 and $199,579,345 for fiscal year 2026-2027. Capital improvement project funding is maintained at the previously amended level of $12,900,000.
appropriations: The final version of the bill appropriates general fund operating totals of $201,725,676 for FY 2025-2026 and $199,579,345 for FY 2026-2027. These amounts are higher than the approximately $198.8 million for each fiscal year that was reflected in the previous version of the fiscal note. The total appropriation for Capital Improvement Projects remains unchanged at $12,900,000 in general obligation bond funds for FY 2025-2026.
agency_impact: The finalized operating budget provides the Judiciary with approximately $2.9 million more in general funds for FY 2025-2026 than was anticipated in the prior fiscal note. This increased appropriation lessens the previously expected negative budgetary impact on the agency. It provides greater capacity to maintain staffing and services compared to the previously considered budget reduction.
policy_impact: The final conference draft reflects a policy compromise between prioritizing capital infrastructure and funding operational needs. By increasing the operating budget from the version considered in the previous fiscal note, the legislature has adopted a more balanced approach. This final measure adjusts the policy to provide additional resources for ongoing judicial operations while still fully funding the significant capital renewal projects.
revenue_sources: The measure specifies multiple means of financing for the Judiciary's budget. Funding is appropriated from General Funds (A), Special Funds (B), and Revolving Funds (W) for operating costs. Capital improvement projects are funded through General Obligation Bond Funds (C).
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: The primary change from the previous fiscal note is the final operating budget amounts as determined by the conference committee. The general fund operating appropriation was increased to $201,725,676 for FY 2025-2026 and $199,579,345 for FY 2026-2027, which is higher than the approximately $198.8 million per year cited previously. The capital improvement project appropriation of $12,900,000 remains unchanged from the prior version.
